input: Bob is white. Erin is big. Erin is green. Gary is green. Gary is nice. Harry is furry. Harry is kind. All white, nice people are green. If someone is white then they are nice. If someone is white and green then they are nice. All kind, nice people are big. If someone is big then they are cold. All green people are cold. If Erin is kind and Erin is furry then Erin is cold. All cold people are kind. If someone is white and not green then they are not kind. Question: Bob is big.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Bob : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant White : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Green : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Cold : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : White Bob
axiom T2 : Big Erin
axiom T3 : Green Erin
axiom T4 : Green Gary
axiom T5 : Nice Gary
axiom T6 : Furry Harry
axiom T7 : Kind Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Nice x → Green x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, White x → Nice x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ Green x → Nice x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Kind x ∧ Nice x → Big x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Cold x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Green x → Cold x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Kind Erin ∧ Furry Erin → Cold Erin
axiom R8 : ∀ x : obj, Cold x → Kind x
axiom R9 : ∀ x : obj, White x ∧ ¬ Green x → ¬ Kind x

theorem bob_is_big : Big Bob :=
begin
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R8,
  apply R5,
  apply R4,
  split,
  apply R8,
  apply R6,
  apply R1,
  split,
  exact T1,
  apply R2,
  exact T1,
  apply R2,
  exact T1,
end

-- The answer is True
